intro: Ptilotus carlsonii, commonly known as the stink bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often unpleasant odor. The plant produces showy, yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, and it thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Ptilotus carlsonii is often found in sandy soils and can be a common weed in disturbed areas.
